purpose: A thread pool implementation using blocking queues for message passing between threads. Provides thread pool management with message posting capabilities.

public_functions.name: new
public_functions.signature: pub fn new<F>(nt:u8, f:F) -> ThreadPool<M> where F: FnOnce(&BlockingQueue<M>) -> () + Send + 'static + Copy

parameters.name: nt
parameters.description: number of threads to create in the pool

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: function closure that defines the processing logic for each thread

public_functions.description: Creates a new thread pool with specified number of threads, each running the provided function

public_functions.name: wait
public_functions.description: Waits for all threads in the pool to finish execution

public_functions.name: post_message
public_functions.signature: pub fn post_message(&mut self, _msg:M) where M:Debug + Clone

parameters.name: _msg
parameters.description: message to post to the thread pool's blocking queue

public_functions.description: Posts a message to the thread pool's input queue for processing

public_functions.name: get_message
public_functions.signature: pub fn get_message(&mut self) -> M where M:Debug + Clone + Default
public_functions.description: Returns a default message (placeholder implementation - not fully implemented)

public_classes.name: ThreadPool<M>
public_classes.description: A generic thread pool structure that manages multiple worker threads and a shared blocking queue for message passing
